title: 109_s2366
content: SECTION 1. REPEAL OF RECAPTURE BOND RULE. Section 1 repeals the recapture bond rule in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, specifically amending paragraph (6) of section 42(j) regarding the recapture of credit on the disposition of a building or interest therein. Taxpayers are relieved from additional tax liability if the building is expected to remain a qualified low-income building for the compliance period. Extension of period for assessing deficiency related to building compliance period shall not expire before 3 years after the end of compliance period. Deficiency may be assessed within 3 years despite any legal restrictions. Extension of the assessment period for building compliance deficiencies to 3 years after the compliance period. New section added to the tax code regarding transactions with other persons. "SEC. 6050U. RETURNS RELATING TO PAYMENT OF LOW-INCOME HOUSING CREDIT REPAYMENT AMOUNT." "Owners of buildings in compliance period must report recapture to IRS. Return must include former investors' info and credit recapture amount." Every person required to make a return under subsection (a) must furnish a written statement to each person whose name is required in the return, including the name, address, and phone number of the person making the return. The statement should also include the information required for the return and must be provided by March 31 of the following year. The compliance period for making returns under subsection (a) is defined in section 42(i). Assessable penalties under section 6724(d)(1) of the Code include penalties related to low-income housing credit repayment amounts. The compliance period for making returns under subsection (a) is defined in section 42(i). Assessable penalties under section 6724(d)(1) of the Code include penalties related to low-income housing credit repayment amounts. Subparagraph (AA) amends subparagraph (BB) by adding a new subparagraph (CC) related to section 6050U for low-income housing credit repayment amounts. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for subpart B of part III of subchapter A of chapter 61 of the Code. The amendments made by this section apply to any liability for the credit recapture amount under section 42(j) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 that arises after the enactment of this Act. In cases where a building was sold before the enactment of this Act, the taxpayer may elect to notify the Secretary of the Treasury in writing if a bond or alternative security was posted under section 42(j) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments allow taxpayers to notify the Secretary of the Treasury in writing to change bond requirements under section 42(j) of the Internal Revenue Code.
